title: Oil Prices Plunge 2.5% as OPEC, IEA Outlooks Point to Softer Market
summary: Oil prices tumbled on Tuesday, with Brent down 2.46% at $63.56 a barrel at 9:54 a.m. ET, and West Texas Intermediate (WTI) slid 2.64% to $59.43, as traders reacted to fresh signals of easing supply pressure and waning demand momentum through early 2026. title: Trump’s Tariffs Send U.S. Aluminum Prices to Record Highs
